page.title: 04KING'S THEATRE SOUTHSEA
page.content: The {King's Theatre}was opened in September 1907. The theatre is in Albert Road Southsea. About 1650 people can be seated in the theatre. There are four levels, they are the stalls, dress-circle, upper-circle,and the gods.In early days,up in the gods the poor people used to pay 1 whole penny,so they could see the plays without mixing with the rich people.Also in the gods there is the Limes,a room where the spotlights shine onto the stars on the stage.The sound and lighting are worked by computer.The stage is sloped and was built over a small stream.The {Kings} is one of the premiere theatres in England.Today they stage musicals ,pantomimes,and plays.They do not write the plays we see,they are offered to them by touring companies.
